original_title: Increased fuel quota will continue this week too: D.V. Chanaka
original_body_lines: The Power and Energy Ministry has decided to continue with the increased fuel quota that was provided for the New Year season in the same way during the next week as well.
Power and Energy State Minister D.V. Chanaka said the increased quota will be renewed as of today.

He further said that a decision will be taken in the future whether to continue with the increased fuel quota after analyzing the figures, including consumption on the days when the fuel quota was increased.
However, a meeting will be held today to analyze the fuel consumption after increasing the quota, the state minister said.

The fuel quota for passenger three-wheelers (special) has been increased from 10 to 15L, three-wheelers (general) from 5 to 8L, motorcycles from 4L to 7L, buses from 40L to 60L, cars from 20L to 30L, land vehicles from 15L to 25L, lorries from 50L to 75L, quadricyles from 4L to 6L, special purpose vehicles from 20L to 30L, and vans from 20L to 30L. (Chaturanga Pradeep Samarawickrama)
